content:
The Clinical Genomics Workgroup has asked Vocabulary Workgroup to correct three canonical URLs in the terminology list:

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/refseq/ -> http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/refseq
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/ -> http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar
http://varnomen.hgvs.org/ -> http://varnomen.hgvs.org

That is: remove the trailing slash. The trailing slashes appear to be have been introduced into the R4 spec as an editorial error.
The Vocabulary WG has approved making this change as part of the technical correction to R4 due out in a couple of weeks if the Clinical Genomics WG can provide good evidence to the Vocab committee by 27th Sept (internal deadline for the technical correction) that this change will not impact on implementers. If you are an implementer that uses one of these code systems, please contact @Patrick Werner ASAP.
@Patrick Werner have you sent this as an email to the FHIR mailing list?
yes! Yesterday to the FHIR mailing list & genomics mailing list.

@Kevin Power @Gil Alterovitz @James Jones
Do you have contacts to people/organization which were part of the group but didn't participate lately? (I remember some guys from china?)
I don't know that I have anyone that would not have been reached by at least one of the approaches thus far.
@Patrick Werner -- Looks like we are due to share info to Vocab by tomorrow (Friday, 27 Sep). Have you gotten any feedback?
Yes, didn't get any feedback. Checked mCode, they don't use one of the affected uris. Our IG examples and bindings aren't using the trailing slashes.
Will write to Vocab now via Zulip and ML.
I marked all Vocab co-chairs in the stream. I will skip the mail, don't want to spam the co-chairs on two channels.
